name: Aquatic invertebrate community
functionStatement: Physical and chemical conditions enable spawning, juvenile growth, migration, and stress survival of target taxa.
descriptionMarkdown: Diverse macroinvertebrates (incl. EPT) if historically expected, unless ephemeral dryness limits.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Collect a rapid kick sample and summarize EPT richness or other screening indicators.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: No EPT. Mostly tolerant midges and worms.
Criteria: Zero EPT orders present.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Only one EPT order present.
Criteria: One EPT order present.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Two of three EPT orders present.
Criteria: Two EPT orders present.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Mayflies, stoneflies, and caddisflies found in kick sample.
Criteria: All three EPT orders present with multiple taxa.

references: USGS BioData and/or EPA Water Quality Portal biological results (where available).
